title: Joel Barnes » Data Scientist | Model Developer | Analytics
text:
Joel Barnes


Data Scientist | Model Developer | Analytics


 j@barnzilla.ca  (613) 408-6089  github.com/barnzilla  linkedin.com/in/joel-barnes-5a80a449  Ottawa, Canada 


Experience


Data Scientist


Statistics Canada   2020 - present  Ottawa, Canada


Develop and maintain POHEM (a longitudinal microsimulation model that forecasts various health risk factors and outcomes — obesity, diabetes, dementia, cardiovascular disease — in Canadians from 2001 to 2050) that is used by the Government of Canada to inform policy decisions.


Authored and maintain chms (an internal, object-oriented R package that applies sleep, physical activity and sedentary behavior algorithms to accelerometer-measured time series data) that a division with no open source expertise used to process accelerometer data on 4,000+ participants for cycle 7 of a nationally representative survey, the Canadian Health Measures Survey.


Authored and maintain ompp4aaw (an internal R package that allows users with little or no proficiency in Linux distributions and Kubernetes to install, compile and run their models) that is used by model developers across several microsimulation divisions.


Authored and maintain Data Dictionary Builder (an R Shiny web-based app that groups survey metadata from flat files across multiple cycles of several national surveys and makes it searchable) that enables Statistics Canada analysts and external researchers to find variables and plan analyses more efficiently.


Modeled Covid-19 cases in nine Canadian provinces on a weekly basis during the Covid-19 pandemic using compartment models via a co-authored R package, EpiSim. Created scenarios that forecasted Covid-19 cases one year into the future. Results were used downstream in a Microsoft Azure pipeline to help the Government of Canada forecast personal protective equipment demand and make evidence-informed procurement decisions.




Data Scientist


CHEO Research Institute   2008 - 2019  Ottawa, Canada


Performed various modeling techniques on large datasets related to movement behaviours (physical activity, sedentary behavior, sleep) and health outcomes in children and youth. Analyses have been published in 70+ peer-reviewed publications contributing to an h-index of 40, which is equivalent to the research output of a full professor.


Served as a “full-stack” web developer that designed, built and maintained five websites on LAMP stacks: activehealthykids.org, capl-eclp.ca, haloresearch.ca, outdoorplaycanada.ca, sedentarybehaviour.org.


Served as lead author on seven ParticipACTION Report Cards on Physical Activity for Children and Youth (2011-2016, 2018), a knowledge translation product that has received one billion+ media impressions and that has an estimated collective ad value of $10 million+.




Freelance Web Developer


Barnzilla Web Development   2006 - present  Ottawa, Canada


Develop, design and maintain custom websites for clients on virtual private servers (LAMP stacks). Some of these clients are academic research networks where custom code is actively deployed to handle all aspects of conference management (e.g., abstract submission and review, membership and conference registration, fee processing).


Develop custom web-based dashboards that reshape, filter and visualize data based on user behavior (e.g., Canada Grains Council Trade Data Online, Covid-19 cases in Canada).


Have developed and designed 50+ websites for clients since 2006.




Skills


Modeling, Analysis and Visualization  R, Python, OpenM++, C++, SQLite, Shiny, Quarto


Builds, Deployment and Pipelines  Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, DigitalOcean droplets, Kubeflow, Kubernetes, Jupyter Notebook, Docker, Grafana


Stacks  Debian, Ubuntu, Apache, Nginx, MySQL, MariaDB, PHP


Frontend  HTML, CSS/SCSS, jQuery, JavaScript, DataTables, WordPress, React, Vue

MSc in Kinesiology


University of Saskatchewan   Saskatoon, Canada
